Master Of The Skies (3:43)
On Top Of His Game
The Flying City (5:17)
Pride Of A New Era
- The Last Days
Land Of The Dawn (4:21)
Back To Zero. Or Less
So This Is The Future (5:04)
They Used To Look Forward To This
Black Market (4:27)
How Much For This Fuel Cartridge
Gang Wars (4:12)
Bad Guys Vs. Worse Guys
Place Of Refuge (4:31)
No One Will Find Us Here. Hopefully
They Are Coming (4:15)
Probably Not For Tea
Some Hope (5:00)
A Flower Amid The Rubble
Fight For Survival (4:26)
Your Gas Mask Or Your Life
Into The Light (5:07)
Is There Anyone Left?

Total Playing Time: 159:33 minutes

135898.name: Herokon Online Soundtrack
135898.description:
promo text from publisher:
Countless fantastic stories and adventures have already been set to music by Erdenstern. After eleven concept albums with atmospheric symphonic soundtracks for role playing games, we now start out for the online version of The Dark Eye.
From a peaceful village, the heroes start on a great, adventurous journey across the whole continent. Dark forests, vast plains and rough terrain have to be traversed, hostile townsfolk and quarrelsome peasants must be faced, as well as whole enemy armies. We visit amazing places like the Great Academy of Magic and the local temple, and set out to new adventures on board a proud vessel.
This soundtrack for Herokon Online is an exciting new stage of your journey.

Tracklist:

The Book Of Herokon (3:46) expectant, rising
Welcome To The Adventure! (4:16) introductory, graceful
This Is Home (2:36) folkloristic, placid
Play The Old Tunes! (4:05) lively, cheerful
Golden Leaves Of Autumn (4:21) calm, melancholic
Over Wide Plains (4:28) uplifting, graceful, vast
Thick Undergrowth (3:07) eerie, ghostly
Cut And Thrust (3:15) rhythmic, driving
Through The Quagmire (3:22) onerous, scary, sad
Our Temple (3:58) powerful, bright, spherical
For The King And For The People (4:32) heroic, proud
Hold The Hillock! (2:40) militarily, rhythmic, driving
In Dark Corners (3:33) menacing, lurking
Dive Bar (3:34) drunk, coarse
Three Feet Of Snow (3:21) cold, intense, huge
The Academy Of Magic (3:31) busy, playful, magical
Warriors To The Horizon (3:29) driving, gigantic
In Front Of The Great Temple (3:42) impressive, solemn, huge
Favorable Winds (3:49) lively, proud, intense
Age Of Adventure (5:36) graceful, epic

Total playing time: 79:46 min

135899.name: Ruf der Titanen
135899.description:
("Call of the Titans", booklet is German only)

promo text from publisher:
Our first CD not to be released in our Library of Fantastic Music — but a genuine Erdenstern album nonetheless!

In cooperation with Prometheus Games, we have released the official soundtrack for the German Pen & Paper RPG Elyrion — 19 Tracks in proven Erdenstern quality :-)
We have added a few new flavours, musically, and went down a few new roads. Elyrion's combination of Fantasy and Steam Punk elements have been a great inspiration on that journey.

Tracklist:

Der Kontinent Audakia (4:33) — dynamic, heroic, powerful
Zwischen Finsternis und Licht (4:04) — mighty, heavy, introductory
Die Schänke (3:43) — merry, folkloristic, strange
Krieger aus Stahl (3:36) — determined, driving, rhythmic
Handel und Wandel (3:51) — dancing, lively, flowing
Die Quelle Elyrions (4:44) — magnificent, rising, mystic
Berge und Ebenen (4:12) — calm, wide, expectant
Die Kerusk-Wüste (3:30) — lurking, uncertain, mystic
Feuer und Stahl (2:49) — hektic, menacing, gigantic
Steppenreiter (4:22) — vivid, flowing, rhythmic
Wolfsland (4:00) — hounded, uncertain, rhythmic
Das Erbe der Titanen (4:07) — rising, great, mighty
Die Schwarze Fäule (3:36) — painful, agonizing, nauseous
Die Festung im Eis (2:58) — mystic, calm, grand
Die dunkle Macht Anhjôrais (3:59) — brutal, mighty, destructive
Die Stadt in den Wolken (3:57) — impressive, great, vivid
Die Mysterien Tithals (3:28) — graceful, hovering, noble
Die Stunde des Schicksals (4:56) — determined, epic, opposing
Die Erben der Schöpfung (3:23) — solemn, calm, mighty

Total playing time: 74:32 min.

135904.name: La Hache & le Feu: Demnukys l'Exécutrice

135900.description:
La Hache & le Feu is a cooperative boardgame for 2 players (more with the expansions) which take on the roles of courageous heroes.

During each game, the heroes embark on quests and venture into dark dungeons to battle monsters, earn gold.

With danger lurking in every shadow, combat is a necessity. For such times, La Hache & le Feu uses a dice-based system. Players use dice according to their character's abilities and weapons.

Featuring 16 modular board pieces, 5 dices, many tokens and 55 cards, etc.
135900.name: La Hache & Le Feu

135902.name: La Hache & le Feu: la Porte des Damnés
135902.description:
This expansion add 10 adventures to the campaign of the basic set and the rules for the use of event cards.

Components:
8 new dungeons floor tiles
10 cardboard figurines
8 new monster cards
8 new treasure cards
10 event cards
1 booklet

135903.name: La Hache & le Feu: Torkreyghèn de Kisadyn
135903.description:
This expansion add a new hero to the game. Torkreyghèn is a fighter but he can use magic. He is specialized with attacks and armor using.

With this expansion comes the rules for blocking attacks with a shield.

Components:
1 cardboard figurine
1 Hero sheet
1 Hero marker
8 equipment cards
8 magical objects cards
11 potion cards
many pawns

135904.name: La Hache & le Feu: Demnukys l'Exécutrice
135904.description:
This expansion add a new hero to the game. Demnukys is an assasin woman. She uses magic as well as fighting abilities. She is specialized with ranged attacks.

With this expansion comes the rules for blocking attacks with a shield.

Components:
1 cardboard figurine
1 Hero sheet
1 Hero marker
8 equipment cards
8 magical objects cards
11 potion cards
many pawns

135905.name: Tiny & Big in Grandpa's Leftovers
135905.description:
Set in land where common physics apply, but everything else looks different. You are Tiny, a technophile guy with a ray cutter, a gripping-device and a fine attitude towards the world. But now your nemesis Big again stole the only heritage your grandpa left you: A nice pair of white, fine rib underpants! And he‘s surely up to no good, why else would he take them to that forsaken desert… Where noone goes! So load up that selfmade raygun and rope device (snitched from the local hardware store) and take your annoying and jabbering backpack to accompany you. It‘s always been good use to your gramps. Besides, the robot taxi to the desert is waiting! Run, jump, drag, shove and laser your way through the ultimately ancient scenery, gain back those underpants!

Source: The Publisher Website.

135906.name: The Phantom of Wilson Creek

rpgpodcastepisode.95266: Call of Cthulhu – The Phantom of Wilson Creek – Return to Yellow Buck Mountain

135906.description:
From the publisher's website:

Something haunts the area of Wilson Creek, North Carolina.

There is an evil that seems to inhabit the old Campbell House that lies south of the tiny, struggling, logging village of Mortimer, whose bad times still lie before it.

The foothills of the Appalachian Mountains is an area rich in culture and history, though short on paved roads, telephones, indoor plumbing, and nearby help.

This book contains three scenarios that create an arc as well as one interim session that can be played at any point, between or during any of the others.

135907.name: Idaho Smith and the Terracotta Terror
135907.description:
User Description

Idaho Smith and the Terracotta Terror is a miniatures mini game.

The game is set in 1932 and is about Idaho Smith and his travels to find the fabled white Pyramid in China. Smith finds the Pyamid but awakes evil sorecer and his army Terracotta Warriors. The aim of the game is to fight off to Terracotta army.

All the players takes the side of the explores and the Terracotta Warriors are controlled by rolling a dice on a reaction table.

The rules are simple and can be played solo if desired.

The desciption is based on the rules published in Ragnarok, issue 43.

135908.name: Gammaslayers Vorschau: Der Rostige Schlüssel
135908.description:
From Introduction:

Willkommen zum Preview-Abenteuer für „Gammaslayers“. Ich hoffe, dass die Erkundung des postapokalyptischen Rasthofes „Zum Rostigen Schlüssel“ und seiner Bewohner einen interessanten und abwechslungsreichen Vorgeschmack auf die verstrahlte Zukunft bieten.

Bis zum Erscheinen von GS können die Regeln von Dungeonslayers 4.0 für das Szenario angewendet werden.

Das Szenario spielt in der später erscheinenden Mittlandkampagne Teil I („Schrott und Fleisch“: Schrottplatz), kann aber auch problemlos in eine Vielzahl von eigenen Szenarien eingebunden werden.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Welcome to the preview adventure for "gamma Layers". I hope to explore the post-apocalyptic picnic area "to rusty key" and its inhabitants offer an interesting and varied taste of the irradiated future.

Until the appearance of GS, the rules of Dungeonslayers 4.0 for the scenario to be applied.

The scenario takes place in the later appearing Mittlandsskogen Campaign Part I ("scrap meat": junkyard), but can also be easily integrated into a variety of custom scenarios.

135909.name: Das Refunghium
135909.description:
From Introduction:

Die Charaktere werden von Bewohnern eines Dorfes gebeten, einem seltsamen Phänomen nachzugehen (Lohn: 100 Battens): Einige Dorfbewohner verschwinden nächstens im Ödland und manchmal werden auch andere Bewohner verschleppt. Alle kehren mit einem seltsam veränderten Wesen zurück und konzentrieren ihre stiere Arbeit auf den Anbau einer seltsamen Pflanze auf den Feldern. Folgen die Charaktere einigen der Bewohnern, kommen sie zu einem verlassenen Gehöft in dessen Keller der Zugang zu einem privaten Bunker befindet.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The characters are requested by residents of a village, a strange phenomenon to investigate (salary: 100 Battens): Some villagers disappear before long in the wasteland and sometimes other residents displaced. All returns with a strangely altered nature and focus their work bulls on a strange plant growing in the fields. Follow some of the inhabitants of the characters, they come to an abandoned farm in the basement with access to a private bunker is.

135910.name: Der Gruene Fluss
135910.description:
From Introduction:

Ein Dorf droht auszudörren, da der versorgende Fluss seit einigen Tagen voller grüner radioaktiver Schlacke ist. Der alte Eremit, der die Pumpstation bewachte berichtet von einem großen grünen Wesen, welches den Fluss verwandelte und ihn vertrieb.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A village threatens auszudörren because the river is serving the last few days full of green radioactive slag. The old hermit who guarded the pumping station reported a large green creature, which turned the river and drove him away.

135911.name: Das Letzte Gefecht
135911.description:
From Introduction:

Auf einer Mission in einer nahen Ruinenstadt haben die Charaktere eine ganze Horde Zombies und Mutanten aufgeschreckt und haben es auf ihrer Flucht bis zu dem Wrack eines Fahrzeuges geschafft. Alle sind todmüde und erschöpft. Gerade, als sie erneut aufbrechen wollen, entdeckt einer der SCs, dass sich Zombies und Mutanten von allen Seiten dem Fahrzeug nähern. Wenn die SCs ansagen, die Minen aus der Kiste bei [2] zur Sicherung des Geländes zu verwenden, ist bei den mit einem Stern markierten Plätzen eine Splittermine platziert.
Es folgt eine Verteidigung von der erhöhten Position aus.


Translation courtesy of Google:

On a mission in a nearby ruined city of the characters have startled a whole horde of zombies and mutants and have succeeded in their flight up to the wreckage of a vehicle. All are tired and exhausted. Just as they want to break again, discovered one of the SCs that zombies and mutants approaching from all sides of the vehicle. If the PCs announce that mines use out of the box in to [2] for securing the premises, at the places marked with an asterisk is placed a split dates.
It follows from a defense of the raised position.

135913.name: The Curse of Crowley Manor: Other-Venture 2
135913.description:
Back of Box

The scene is London, in 1913. Scotland Yard is buzzing with the news - there's been a murder at the Crowley Estate! What starts out as a simple homicide investigation turns into a trip into the depths of the occult as you try to solve The Curse of Crowley Manor. This program uses many unique plot-twists and strange devices to guide you through a victory, or a certain trip to the gates of hell. Second in the Other Venture Series, this program is sure to keep you riveted to your computer screen waiting for the next axe to fall!

135914.name: Der Unterschlupf
135914.description:
From Introduction:

Ein Auftraggeber hat es auf „Tirams Bande“ abgesehen, die sich in den Ruinen einer Siedlung versteckt halten. Ziel ist die Auslöschung der Banditen und bergen einer „Hyperfusionsbatterie“, die die Banditen bei ihrem letzten Raubzug erbeuteten.
Sind die Banditen ausgeschaltet und die Batterie gesichert, finden die SCs eine Mitteilung, dass die Banditen von Evo-Agenten rekrutiert wurden, die Batterie zu stehlen. Was folgt ist die Landung eines Helikopters mit Evo-Powerrittern und X-Bots im Südosten. Nachdem die SCs die Häuser zuerst einnehmen mussten, müssen sie sie nun verteidigen. Dazu haben sie allerdings noch einigen Minuten Zeit, um das Gelände zu befestigen.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A client has it apart to "Tirams gang" who are hiding in the ruins of a settlement. The goal is the annihilation of the bandits and recover a "Hyperfusion battery" which captured the bandits in their last raid.
Are the bandits off and the battery secured, the PCs find a message that the bandits were recruited by Evo agents to steal the battery. What follows is the land a helicopter Evo Power Knights and X-bots in the southeast. After the SCs occupy the houses first, they had to have to defend it now. For this they have still a few minutes to secure the premises.

135915.name: Menschen Fleisch
135915.description:
From Introduction:

Die Bewohner einer Enklave bitten die SCs um Hilfe. Mehrere Dorfbewohner sind in den letzten Wochen spurlos in der Nähe der alten Mine verschwunden.
Wenn die Charaktere die Mine untersuchen, treffen sie auf eine kannibalistische Degeneriertenfamilie, die noch 4 der Dorfbewohner festhalten, einen Großteil aber bereits getötet und verspeist haben.
Ob sie das Szenario eher als reines Hack&Slay oder Horrorszenario als „Wrong Turn“, „The Hills have Eyes“ oder Saw“ benutzen, sei Ihnen überlassen. Das Abenteuer enthält einige „Blood and Gore“ Elemente und ist für volljährige Dungeonslayer gedacht.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The residents of an enclave ask the PCs for help. Several villagers have disappeared in recent weeks in the vicinity of the old mine.
If the characters investigate the mine, they encounter a cannibalistic family degeneracy, which still retain 4 of the villagers, but the majority have been killed and eaten.
Whether they use the scenario rather than pure Hack & Slay or horror scene as "Wrong Turn", "The Hills Have Eyes" or Saw "is up to you. The adventure includes some "Blood and Gore" elements and is intended for adult Dungeon Layer.

135916.name: Escape From Traam: Other-Venture 3
135916.description:
Back of Box

Since their inception, Scott Adams' Adventures have been a mainstay in the libraries of computer owners. Now, the company that brought you these great programs brings you the fantasy-adventure games of other authors in this NEW series. Each program reflects many months and sometimes years of development by their respective authors.

From Jyym Pearson, author of Zossed in Space and Curse of Crowley Manor, now comes a poweful new contender in the popular Other Venture Series: Escape From Traam!

Your small space cruiser is in trouble - and even though you survived the initial crash on a bizarre distant world, you may soon wish that you hadn't! The alien environment of Traam is replete with incredible wonders and sights which no human eyes have ever beheld. You must escape this dangerous world; but be forewarned that if your decisions are not tempered with intellegence and caution, you may not see home again!

In Escape From Traam, as in the rest of the Other Venture series, you manipulate your alter-ego through your computer using brief sentances. Through your micro, you are able to journey through awesome worlds armed only with your wits and wisdom.

135917.name: Earthquake - San Francisco 1906: Other-Venture 4
135917.description:
Back of Box

CAN YOU SURVIVE?

On April 19, 1906 at 5:18 a.m., one of the most violent earthquakes of modern times decimated metropolitan San Francisco. Now, Jyym Pearson (author of Escape From Traam and The Curse of Crowley Manor) has crafted his finest Other Venture to date: EARTHQUAKE--San Francisco 1906! Painstakingly researched with close attention to detail and historical accuracy, EARTHQUAKE puts you into a topsy-turvy scenario: The city's remains are awash with flame; buildings burn and crumble, and death's dark sentry stands watch over all. It is through this madness that you must plunge. Your chances of survival are directly realted to your ability to reason logically. Hopefully, you will escape from fallen San Francisco with your life. EARTHQUAKE features a new powerful data base and is certain to provide you with many hours of thrilling action & challenging puzzles!

135918.name: Sphear: The Greatest Sci-fi/Horror/Action Roleplaying Game of All Time
135918.description:
From Introduction:

Characters in this roleplaying game are everyday folks forced to deal with a very unusual situation: invaders from another world (perhaps another dimension altogether) have settled in the town. Their malevolent intent: to steal human corpses and use them as slave labor on the invaders’ home world.

Your job is to fight back and save the town?or at least, get revenge on those alien bastards.

User note: Inspired by the Phantasm films.

videogame.135913: The Curse of Crowley Manor: Other-Venture 2

135919.name: Jyym Pearson Adventure Tri-Pack

videogamecompilation.135913: The Curse of Crowley Manor: Other-Venture 2

135919.description:
User Summary

A compilation of the three Other-Venture series text adventures authored by Jyym Pearson.

135920.name: Air Flight Simulation
135920.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Take off and land your aircraft without making a crater. This "instruments only" simulation starts you with a full tank of fuel, which gives you a maximum range of about 50 miles. You'll get constant updates of air speed, compass heading and altitude. After you've acquired a few hours of flight time, you can try flying a course against a map or doing acrobatic maneuvers.

135921.name: Airmail Pilot
135921.description:
Publisher Advertisement

OK, Ace, you survived everything that von Richthofen and the Flying Circus threw at you. Well, that was four long years ago - and yesterday's medals don't pay the rent. But just a minute, here's an ad:

"Airmail Pilot wanted . . ."

You can almost smell the gasoline as the ground crew fuels your J-4 Jenny biplane to her 26-gallon limit. Precious mail is loaded into the cargo area, tagged for Chicago. The weatherman reports severe icing above 6,000 feet, so you know you have to keep the plane low. It will be a dangerous flight, but you knew that when you took the job. The mail must go through. So, in the tradition of Lindbergh and a hundred unsung heroes, you bravely turn your plane into the wind. The engine roars. Suddenly you're aloft on the first leg of your journey. Dayton's socked in by fog. You change your course for Lucasville. Lightning zigzags the sky. A massive, fast-moving thunderstorm forces you to land in a cornfield. As the weather clears, your plane leaps once more into the sky. But even clear skies can cause problems - violent air currents buffet your fragile wooden aircraft.

Your fuel is down to two gallons as Lucasville comes into sight. You make it! Refuel and head for Chicago. But you're not out of trouble yet. There's a wind shear at the Chicago airport. You have to land in a shifting crosswind. Can you make it?

AIRMAIL PILOT from INSTANT SOFTWARE. Unlike any other computer simulation you've ever experienced. Challenging. Difficult. But never impossible. An event in a cassette. Crash or fly, it's so realistic, you can almost feel the wind.

135922.name: Night Flight
135922.description:
Publisher Advertisement

May, 1941— The dreaded Nazi battleship, the Bismarck, has broken out of the North Sea and is now somewhere in the North Atlantic. Your mission is to make a nighttime photo reconnaissance flight over the Bismarck. These photos will help the Admiralty determine the extent of damage done to the Bismarck in a previous battle and whether the British fleet has a chance to sink the German pocket battleship.

The Night Flight program lets you take-off, fly, and land a propeller driven aircraft. You can practice approaches and landings with a full on-screen display of the landing field. Or you can go on a mission, follow the radar vectors to your target, and get your photo (hopefully returning safely to your airbase without being shot down).

This program simulates the flight characteristics of a real aircraft with pilot input for all flight maneuvers. During the flight, you are supplied with a real-time stream of flight information, navigational aids, glide-slope markers, and landing field information. The instructions with this program can practically teach you to fly.

Somewhere out on the cold, gray North Atlantic, the Bismarck tries to elude her pursuers. Your photos are vital. Launch yourself into the night sky with the Night Flight package.

135923.name: Jet Fighter Pilot
135923.description:
Publisher Advertisement

In this brilliantly realistic simulation, you become the pilot of a twin turbo-jet fighter. Begin your mission from either the deck of a carrier or from an airfield. During flight, you'll need to constantly monitor your display and make the necessary adjustments to the throttle, flaps, and air spoilers; you must decide when to retract landing gear and release your drop tanks! There is an on-board Navigational Computer, a Glideslope / Localizer and a Weapons Control Computer. Earn your wings with JET FIGHTER PILOT.

135924.name: Space Shuttle
135924.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Just 55 hours ago, 5.3 million pounds of thrust from two solid fuel boosters sent the Space Shuttle Columbia into orbit. Now, on-board computers performing 325,000 separate operations every second will help guide the Columbia safely and gracefully home to Earth.

Instant Software's SPACE SHUTTLE puts you in the command pilot's chair of America's first reusable space vehicle. And, until commercial space flight becomes a reality, this is the closest you'll get to the Ultimate Flight.

135925.name: Flight Path
135925.description:
Publisher Advertisement

The Flight Path package will let you experience all facets of modern day aviation.

Mountain Pilot transforms you into a daring bush pilot as you fly badly needed supplies to a remote gold mining camp. You'll have to cross a hazardous mountain range, while struggling with headwinds, tricky navigation and rapidly diminishing fuel.

Watch your airspeed, altitude and rate-of-climb or you could stall-out and crash. If you deliver your supplies, you can't relax; you must return over those mountains with a heavy cargo of gold bullion.

O'Hare is a control tower simulation where you become an Air Traffic Controller. The lives of hundreds of people become your responsibility as you guide aircraft through your control sector to a safe landing.

You'll have to deal with different aircraft requirements, wind change warnings and potential midair collisions. But no matter what happens, you must bring in twenty aircraft safely on your tour of duty.

Precision Approach Radar combines the skills of pilot and Air Traffic Controller. You become the pilots' eyes as they try to land in limited visibility conditions. Your commands guide the aircraft on their approach to the field - and a safe landing.

The Flight Path package covers both sides of flight procedure, from the thrill of flying to the tense drama of air traffic control.

135926.name: Flying Circus
135926.description:
User Summary

A compilation of flight simulation games (and two air traffic control titles) from Instant Software.

135928.name: Weather Wars: Battle for the Guzunganator
135928.description:
In Weather Wars, you recruit wacky animals to your cause. Once you reach one hundred power worth of animals, or your team reaches 150 power in team play, you take control of the weather machine and win the game. Early on, only small power creatures can be played, but as the game progresses, larger, more powerful creatures come online. Each creature has an ability that triggers when it comes into play, helping your cause or causing mayhem for other players. The season card indicates what season the weather machine has forced on the world. Gather more summer creatures in summer, or more winter creatures in winter, and you'll earn a big season bonus – but watch out! At any time a Season Change Card can flip the season and ruin all your careful planning.

Weather Wars features an unusual hand mechanic - rather than drawing a card each turn, cards are played until a player only has two left in hand. These last two are then discarded and replaced with a 5-card hand. This creates subtle strategic depth - which cards should be played now, which later, and which not at all? It also gives additional meaning to any card ability that allows you to draw extra cards.

Other game features include a catchup mechanic in the form of the Season Change card, game acceleration via prerequisites for playing larger animals, and opportunities for collaboration in team play. The game plays quickly, to allow for frequent replays.

Weather Wars is a family-friendly card game for 2-4 players ages 8 and up, and takes about 20 minutes to play.

135929.name: Jumbo
135929.description:
User Summary

Fly a four-engine jumbo jet between destinations in the UK or on a transatlantic flight. This simple flight simulator focuses on the information displayed on the aircraft's instrument panel and uses mostly text graphics. The game includes graphic maps of England, Scotland, Ireland and the eastern United States.

Programmed by Frank Avery and John Taylor.

135930.name: Concorde
135930.description:
User Summary

Fly the supersonic transport Concorde on transatlantic flights or between airports in western Europe or the eastern United States. This simple flight simulator recreates the aircraft's instruments in basic form using mostly plain-text characters for graphics. The game includes a graphic map showing the Atlantic Ocean and your destination airports.

Programmed by Frank Avery and John Taylor.

135931.description:
Choose your gear. Balance your skills. Hone your strategy.

BattleBrik: The Ultimate Warrior is a tactical miniatures board game that pushes the envelope of the LEGO Games line into new strategic territory. Influenced by Ninjago, BrikWars, The Deadliest Warrior TV show, HeroScape, and other miniatures games, this game will allow you to finally find out who the Ultimate Warrior of your LEGO minfig collection is!

The base game comes with all the dice, tiles, cards, and basic warrior parts needed for 2 to 4 players to quickly start your battles. Players can also purchase "Warrior Packs" (similar to existing Ninjago blisters) or make custom warriors from their existing minifigures.

Players outfit their warrior with weapons and armor, build and balance their Skill & Gear dice, construct a Strategy deck of cards....then face off in the customizable arena!

A key concept of the game is that different colored tiles represent different skills and body locations for the warrior. Based on your warrior's balance of skills, his Skill dice will have a different number of tiles for each of the colors. Likewise, the number and color of tiles on his Gear dice will depend on which armor and weapons you choose. Finally, the experience of the warrior will help him hone his strategy by determining how many and which Strategy cards can be used.

Game play is fast and furious, with both tactical and strategic decisions. The goal of the game is to have your warrior be the last one standing in the arena.

A Basic game and an Advanced game are provided so it can be played by all ages and experience levels. Since it can be described as "easy to learn, but hard to master", it will keep both the casual beginner and grizzled wargamer engaged.
135931.name: BattleBrik: The Ultimate Warrior

135932.name: Airbus
135932.description:
User Summary

A simple flight simulator portraying the Airbus A300 passenger jet. The simulator includes fuel load considerations and radio navigation aids. Programmed by Jan Arkesteijn.

135933.name: Aircraft Approach Simulator
135933.description:
Promotional Blurb

More than a game! Fully equipped aircraft instrument panel allows you to fly the last 8 miles to the airport. Specify airport elevation, winds and turbulence. Six types of approaches.

User Summary

An instrument approach flight simulator that uses mostly text-based graphics to display information that would appear on the aircraft instrument panel.

135934.name: Petz: Horsez 2
135934.description:
- Build a strong relationship with your horses and see their behavior evolve as you train them.
- Renovate your ranch by competing in exciting competitions like cross, jumping, and more!
- Raise a foal from birth and customize your stable with saddles, bridles, and brushes.

Source: The Publisher Website.


Back of Box

The Best Selling horse game, now on Nintendo Wii!

Play as Lily in her most exciting horse adventure. Raise and nurture your horses from foals and train them to win competitions, and ride out freely in the open countryside meeting new people throughout your adventure.

- Take the reins using the Wii Remote and Nunchuck in the most realistic horse game for your Nintendo.
- Train your horses and compete in events such as cross country, jumping and racing.
- Build a strong relationship with your horse and watch how their emotions change according to how you treat them.
- Create your own unique foal and customize it by collecting accessories.

135935.description:
The Hungry Panda Game!
Spin the spinner and match the colours as you play the easy game with younger children, helping one another find food that pandas might like to eat. Or, flip the board and complete to see who can collect the most matching items in the family game. Then, in the bonus game, use the cards to play "Panda Pairs", but watch that you don't get stuck with the odd one out!
- From the back of the box.
135935.name: Wang Wang & Funi

135936.name: The Settlers 7: Paths to a Kingdom – Deluxe Gold Edition
135936.description:
THE SETTLERS 7 – PATHS TO A KINGDOM recreates the building of a kingdom set in the early Renaissance period in a rich, wild, beautiful middle-European world of lush forests, open meadows, fast flowing rivers, and high mountains.

Based on the foundations of the highly acclaimed Settlers games, you will easily become engaged in an exciting campaign, skirmish maps and multi-player challenges.

An innovative victory point system gives you a lot of variety to build up your blossoming kingdom. Several options, customizable maps, player generated content and a strong online support will guarantee wide-ranging experiences encouraging you to play over and over again.

Source: The Game Website.

135937.name: Bao Qing Tian Shen An
135937.description:
Bao Qing Tian Shen An(包青天審案)is a party game published around the early 90's. The year is not quite sure as the old publishers didn't print the date on the games. The publisher was closed so it is hard to get the exact date.

Bao Zheng(包拯)(999-1062, also named Bao Qing Tian 包青天) was a much-praised official who served during the reign of Emperor Renzong of Northern Song Dynasty in ancient China. He was respected as a fair justice. His stories are popular in Chinese people.

In each turn, a player plays a card facedown and draw a card. Players in this game would play different roles. The First player who play the Emperor become Emperor (play Emperor faceup). Then Emperor have to call out Bao Qing Tian. Other players who have Bao Qing Tian card can play it to become Bao Qing Tian. The Bao Qing Tian have to decide which player(s) are the police, Wang Zhao(王朝) and Ma Han(馬漢), depending on their cards. AS soon as the officers are decided, The Emperor says which kind of criminals he want to get rid of (there are 4 kinds of offenders). Then the police can look at one player's hand when his turn is or catch other players' cards when they discard. Bao Qing Tian have to count the times when the police searches, but the limit is 10 searches. If the police arrests the criminal, Bao Qing Tian decides how to punish the player who holds the criminal. Otherwise, the police is punished. For example, a punishment may require player to sing a song, make a funny face, etc. At this time, if players have the mathematical symbols (add, plus, subtract, minus), they can help or afflict the criminal. Sometimes the criminal would have those symbolic cards and he can help himself. If the criminal is the Emperor, he can cancel his punishment (this is the dark side of this game).

135938.name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Pocket Adventure

videogameversion.194010: North American Neo Geo Pocket Color edition

135938.description:
Sonic the Hedgehog Pocket Adventure is a platform video game in the Sonic the Hedgehog series. It was released in December 1999 in North America, and May 2000 in Japan, exclusively for the Neo Geo Pocket Color handheld game console. It is also the first game of the Sonic series ever to be released on a video game console licensed by a different company other than Sega.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic the Hedgehog Pocket Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135939.description:
This 2nd supplement of Black Powder covers the Napoleonic Wars Peninsular Campaign. The rules expansion overviews the main battles, armies and personalities and includes army lists, scenarios and special rules. Featured conflicts and battles include:
The Flanders Campaign 1793-95
Rolica 1808
Vimeiro 1808
Talavera 1809
Granja de la Abundancia 1810
Guidad Espanola 1810
Fuentes de Onoro 1811
Salamanca 1812
135939.name: Albion Triumphant Vol 1: The Peninsular Campaign

135940.name: The Kobold Guide to Worldbuilding

rpghonor.23150: 2013 ENnie for Best RPG Related Product - Gold Winner

135940.description:
Roleplaying games and fantasy fiction are filled with rich and fascinating worlds: the Forgotten Realms, Glorantha, Narnia, R'lyeh, Middle-Earth, Barsoom, and so many more. It took startling leaps of imagination as well as careful thought and planning to create places like these: places that readers and players want to come back to again and again.

Now, eleven of adventure gaming's top designers come together to share their insights into building worlds that gamers will never forget. Learn the secrets of designing a pantheon, creating a setting that provokes conflict, determining which historical details are necessary, and so much more. Then take that creative leap, and create dazzling worlds of your own!

135941.name: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
135941.description:
Game Box

The Griffins find themselves on the edge of destruction. Battle Bertram on your own damn terms. Battle through demented worlds that only the show's writers could create. Face off against whacked out foes in co-op and multipplayer!

135943.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 2 - Feb 8, 2012)
135943.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #2: Monsters That Improve with Age

An age chart can be a wonderful tool for Game Masters who want to scale monster encounters so that they are commensurate with the powers and artifacts possessed by the player characters. A chart of this sort is made up of three columns, one each for the age of a creature, its hit dice, and notes. Notes include damage, mutations, drawbacks, and anything else that affects the creature in or out of combat.

There are a few alternate forms for these charts. Most have Hit Dice that increase by one per age level, a few do not. Some have hit dice that constantly increase, and some decrease after a certain level to represent the weaknesses of aging (I call these “elder age” charts). Some creatures can have multiple age charts, which represents changes in diet, habitat, proximity of other specific creatures, or exposure to certain elements, such as heat or radiation. In most cases, once a creature has started its path down one chart, it is restricted to that chart for its entire life. In rare cases a mutant can change growth charts but this means they have to survive exposure to an extreme of something, which could include radiation, chemicals, parasites, or disease. And, finally, there are those mutants that go through metamorphosis and have one or more age charts (e.g., a larval form might have one age chart and the adult form another).

135944.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 3 - Feb 15, 2012)
135944.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #3: High-Tech Weapons

Like magical weapons in fantasy games, high technology firearms are treasures that adventurers seek out with great eagerness in the post-apocalyptic world. No matter how cool a weapon is, however, players will always be looking for something better to use against the many hazards that populate the science fantasy post-apocalyptic wastes, and this third issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands is devoted to new toys that Game Masters can use to reward — or punish — their players. Several of the new weapons presented herein have the option of different types of ammunition, to add even more variety to a GM’s game.

135945.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 4 - Feb 22, 2012)
135945.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #4: New Races

Even though some post-apocalyptic game worlds have only allowed Humans, mutants, mutant plants, and animals as characters, there has always been room to expand upon this. Mutant Future did an admirable job by introducing androids and other similarly “created” races but not enough to please many players and game masters. With that in mind, this issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands contains seven new “races” for players and GMs to use in their campaigns. Two are essentially mirror images of one another, while another brings in a group that was completely missed in the Mutant Future game.

These are general guidelines and are as such subject to the whims and moods of the GM. The GM can use as many or as few of the races presented here, as they stand or with his own modifications. Rules for dealing with robots are also included at the end of the article.

135946.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 5 - Feb 29, 2012)
135946.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #5: Domesticated Creatures

With the huge variety of life, domesticated creatures in Mutant Future come in all shapes and sizes. Some are harmless, some are inherently dangerous, and some become so when they are not tended and become feral. This issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands contains 10 new creatures that the people of the post-apocalyptic wastes have relationships with and make use of in various ways.

135948.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 22 - Jan 1, 2013)
135948.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #22: Personal Shields

Force screens were developed for individuals from all walks of life, to guard them from all manner of threats. There were simple fields that warded users from the insults of weather and city life, those that protected police against small caliber firearms, and those used in military powered armor systems and combat vehicles. All shields operate on the same basic mechanic: they project a protective an energy field around the user.

135949.name: Surf 'n Tour
135949.description: The object of the game is to circle the board until you have landed on all 12 of the Surf Spots. By landing on other squares you either collect or pay money depending on the instructions. There are also Trivia Challenge squares that tests your knowledge of surfing. The winner is the first player to land on all 12 Surf Spots.

135950.name: Columbia
135950.description:
Back in the late 1700’s. Two North-American fur trading corporations compete to expand their routes: the Hudson’s Bay Company, based in London (represented by red trading post cards), and the North West Company of Montreal (represented by blue trading post cards). Players mount expeditions to establish trading posts and earn money by trading pelts.

Columbia is a fast-paced card-management, action-selection game. The game material is composed of cards (expedition cards and trading post cards, both relating to traps, barters, canoes and sales), cubes representing animals and furs (beaver, wolf and bear) and coins.

The game is divided into 13 turns. Each turn is divided into 3 phases. Each phase is performed simultaneously by all players.

The richest player at the end wins.

videogame.135954: Gears of War 2: Combustible Map Pack

135951.name: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection
135951.description:
User Summary

The All Fronts Collection is a DLC that includes 19 multiplayer maps and a previously deleted campaign chapter to expand Gears of War 2.

videogame.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135952.name: Gears of War 2: Dark Corners

videogamecompilation.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135952.description:
User Summary

Gears of War 2: Dark Corners is a DLC expansion to Gears of War 2. It includes 7 new multiplayer maps and a previously deleted campaign chapter.

The maps are:

Allfathers Garden
Memorial
Sanctuary
War Machine
Highway
Way Station
Nowhere

videogame.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135953.name: Gears of War 2: Flashback Map Pack

videogamecompilation.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135953.description:
User Summary

The Flashback Map Pack is a pack-in expansion for Gears of War 2 that can be freely downloaded. The download is packaged as a large card with a tearaway back that reveals the install code. The maps included are all reworked maps from Gears of War. They include:

Canals
Tyro Station
Mansion
Gridlock
Subway

videogame.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135954.name: Gears of War 2: Combustible Map Pack

videogamecompilation.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135954.description:
User Summary

The Combustible Map Pack is the 2nd DLC expansion for Gears of War 2. It adds three new multiplayer maps to the game, all designed around explosive elements. They are:

Flood
Gold Rush
Fuel Station

videogame.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135955.name: Gears of War 2: Snowblind Map Pack

videogamecompilation.135951: Gears of War 2: All Fronts Collection

135955.description:
User Summary

The Snowblind Map Pack is the 3rd downloadable expansion for Gears of War 2. It contains 4 snow-themed multiplayer maps. They are:

Fuel Depot
Courtyard
Under Hill
Grind Yard

The Fuel Depot and Courtyard maps are remakes of maps included in Gears of War.

135956.name: Caravan to Ein Arris
135956.description:
From Steve Jackson Games' website:

"The city is buzzing when Halmaro the Red, the head of the Merchants' Guild, organizes the greatest caravan the world has ever seen to deliver his daughter . . . and her fabulous dowry . . . to Ein Arris for her wedding. There is a wealth of opportunity for resourceful adventurers whose wits are as keen as their swords -- are you one of them?
Caravan to Ein Arris was originally published in the GURPS Basic Set, in the pre-revision Third Edition. It was out of print for years, then brought back in PDF form. And now, it's been completely updated for the Fourth Edition of GURPS!

Ein Arris has always been a wonderful introductory adventure for the GURPS system, and now it's doing it again for Fourth Edition. And best of all . . . it's free! So fire up your computer and give it a spin, and take the Caravan to Ein Arris!"

135957.name: Advanced Strategic Command
135957.description:
"Advanced Strategic Command is a free, turn based strategy game. It is designed in the tradition of the Battle Isle series from Bluebyte and is currently available for Windows and Linux.

ASC can be played both against the AI and against other human players, using hotseat or PlayByMail. It is also used to run the multiplayer universe Project Battle Planets."

If you have Linux, you can probably find this game in your distribution's repository with the name asc.

Source: The Publisher Website.

135958.name: GURPS Casey & Andy
135958.description:
From Steve Jackson Games website:

"Welcome to a comic-strip world where the golden light of science holds the promise of a better future for all humanity.
Yeah, right.

Science can indeed do anything - which means scientists are the most powerful, important people in the world. (OK, this is clearly not our world.) And at the top of the heap are those undaunted by the constraints of inadequate theories, the challenges of defying conventional wisdom, and the dangers of nuclear radiation. In short, mad scientists.

GURPS Casey & Andy is based on Andy Weir's hilarious webcomic Casey & Andy. The title characters are 21st-century mad scientists dabbling in time and dimension travel, instantaneous cloning, and increasingly complex apocalyptic doomsday devices. Apart from that, they live in suburbia with their girlfriends, Mary and Satan. Yes, that Satan.

GURPS Casey & Andy is also a complete GURPS Fourth Edition sourcebook available only as a PDF right here on e23! Casey & Andy is written by David Morgan-Mar, who knows a thing or two about webcomics with his own Irregular Webcomic, and certainly knows a thing or two about writing for e23. It also features tons of Casey & Andy art by webcomic creator Andy Weir, including an original four-page story just for this PDF!"

135959.name: Cosmic Enforcers
135959.description:
From the back of the book:

"A superpowered science fiction role playing game

Myrmidon Press puts you in control of techno-powered super heroes and villains in a hard core science fiction future of the year 2025. Earth Central sits at the head of the table of the Galactic Alliance, a coalition of the Milky Way's seven known races. After years of warfare, peace finally reigns, but not for long...

Dark forces have gathered their power waiting for the perfect time to strike down the alliance and restore chaos to the universe. Now, only one barrier stands in the way of their obsession with total anarchy. They are known as the Cosmic Enforcers, the Galactic Alliance's last bastion of defense, and the only hope to save all that is known from the brink of madness.

Game highlights include:


Easy high powered character generation
Fast and playable combat system
Many types of super-powered Cosmic Enforcers to choose from
Progressive power advancement
Total control of magic and psionics
Over 291 super powers
Plenty of robots, cybergadgets, power armour, and weapons
Insane villains, noble heroes, and insidious aliens guarantee many hours of exciting adventure

135960.name: Aces and Faces
135960.description:
Players move around the board trying to acquire Aces and Face cards, trying to collect 4 of a kind or 4 from one suit. To move around the board, you flip up the top card from the deck. If it is a number, you can move that many spaces either direction on the board. If it is an ace or face card, you move to the space with that card and collect it into your hand from the board.

The board has 4 types of spaces. It either has a specific card that you can collect, or is a duel space, where you pick a player and each of you pick a card off the top of the deck, with the higher card getting to take a card from the one drawing the lower card, or a higher/lower space, where you guess if the next card in the deck will be higher or lower than the last card drawn, or Suit Match, where you draw the next card and if it matches the suit of the space you are on, you can take a card of that suit into your hand.

135961.name: Villains & Foes
135961.description:
From the back of the book:

"The newest supplement for Cosmic Enforcers focuses on the criminals and miscreants of the Galaxy - from sinister villains to misguided heroes, from super-powered terrorists to insane murderers.


Enemies Galore: Dozens of villains, organizations, and teams to throw against your heroic Enforcers.



City of Sin: Chicago in the 21st century is owned by the criminals. Inside you will find important characters, the rulers of the Windy City, and their minions.



Cybenetics [sic]: Limbs, weapons, and deadly Combat Chassis.



New Weapons, Powers, Magic and Psionics: Useful information for any Enforcers Campaign, from lethal blasters to such powers as Cold Weather Manipulations and Pleasure and Pain Projection. Plus a new archetype: the Jacker-technologist, master hacker and electronic courier of the Information Age.



Designed for use for Cosmic Enforcers, but usable by any Super-heroic or Science Fiction RPG."

135962.name: Vindicators
135962.description:
From the back of the book:

NOW YOU CAN BECOME YOUR FAVORITE COMICS HERO!

And not a moment too soon. Crime is running rampant. Natural disasters are on the rise. Sinister organizations are plotting the overthrow of civilization. There's no time to lose. Use the VINDICATORS game system to create your own crime-fighting hero. Pick weapons from the most basic to the most advanced. Use any of dozens of skills. Choose from over one hundred fantastic powers, including psionics, flight, energy control, and heightened senses. Build your strength, speed, and agility to superhuman levels.

Now use the VINDICATORS quick-playing system to put your character into action:


Automatic fatigue rules if you expend strength too fast.



Realistic modifiers for distant or fast moving targets.



Unique PAIN points for automatic handicaps



Super speed rules - not just movement - that work.



Fast roll game scenarios.


Get ready to meet the challenge!"

135963.name: Jiao Tong An Quan
135963.description:
This is a game published around 80's-90's in Taiwan. This is a rolling dice game and combines with knowledge of traffic safety. Once a player goes to Taipei, the game ends and winner is the one who has the most points.

The dices and player tokens are made of rubber. Children can use them as erasers.

135968.name: Barbarian (GC)
135968.description:
User Summary

GameCube fighter, originally slated for US release in 2003, but then only released in Japan under the title Warrior Blade and in Europe as Barbarian in 2004. Under the motto skin, fur and heavy metal, the Saffire-developed Barbarian is an arena-based fighting game with 11 playable characters, each with their own unique weapons and abilities. Defeat your opponent in rich, interactive environments as you collect bloodstones to enhance fighting skills.

135969.name: Vindicators Plus
135969.description:
From the back of the book:

"ALL THE THRILLS OF VINDICATORS -
PLUS MORE!

VINDICATORS has become the hottest new hero game introduced in recent years. Now, VINDICATORS PLUS gives you more to add to your games:

PLUS! Faster play options.
PLUS! New powers and new skills.
PLUS! Origins, Flavors, Motivations, and Connections to round out your characters - either selected or randomly rolled.
PLUS! A wide range of character Passions.
PLUS! More heroes and villains, with complete statistics.
PLUS! Advanced Supervisor's guide on taking your games to dramatic perfection.

Get ready to meet the challenge!"

135970.name: Accionista
135970.description:
Game of financial operations
Accionista mains shareholder in Spanish
Board similar to Monopoly, but include option as Tax Heaven Bonds, Takeover Bid.

The game consists of two to four players and a referee Exchange. Each player has a card of one color and 28 bars of the same color of your tab. Players are placed in the outlet box and go out one by one. Every time you come to a square that represented an action and has no slug, such action the referee should make the Exchange compulsorily the Parquet and all players will bid for it, the more money that will stay with her . The more shares you have the same group may be charged when an opponent gets there.

In the game look not only the number of shares of the same group but it must also look at what makes the index Roulette, which will be on the game board represented by - x - y - z -.

135971.name: Litil Divil
135971.description:
The Game Manual

Mutt’s been selected to enter the Labyrinth of Chaos and embark on the greatest adventure of his uneventful life. He's not happy about it. Why should he have to go and get the pizza?
Like most of us he just can’t be bothered going himself. He’ll have some if you're making it anyway, or indeed, if there’s some going spare; he’ll even go if someone goes with him, but don’t ask him to do it by himself he just can’t be bothered and anyway it’s just not fair!
The world is against him as well!
It’s like you’ve parked your car in the same space in the office car park for the last five years. You’ve had the same car all that time and you’re on first name terms with the attendant ‘George’ who always salutes you with a ‘Morning sir’ as you pass through the gate 8.48 am sharp day in, day out. Then one day you forget your pass. George won’t let you in, claiming you could be anyone and that, of course it’s
‘morethanmyjobsworth!’
You get the picture?"

135973.description:
The Messenger of Courage is a promotional miniature that will only be available through the Kingdom Death: Monster kickstarter and future Kingdom Death special events.

Messenger of Courage was supposed to include:

One plastic Messenger of Courage
One-shot Challenge Scenario
Scout's Tunic Promo Gear Card
One Settlement Event Card
One Hunt Event Card




The Messenger of Courage was shipped in Wave 1 of Kickstarter fulfillment, but the game content mentioned in the campaign was not included. Game creator Adam Poots mentioned that the content would be printed and released on their website eventually. For now, it is available in PDF format on the Kingdom Death website.
135973.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Messenger of Courage Promo Miniature

135974.name: Shadows over the Nile
135974.description:
This is an expansion to the England Invaded game:
A skirmish wargame based around the close of the nineteenth century. The back drop is around Germany launching an invasion of France and Britain. A squad level game, where soldiers fight in desperate battles across urban landscapes in a bid to stem Germany and their powerful war machine. England Invaded comes with a supplement rule book (34 pages) and 10 Figures. (French & German)

Over the Wire used a unique system for developing fire power based on the levels of command you units are under. The better (higher Ranked) your command is the more powerful the attack. The unit sizes are based on Squads of miniatures where each base is an Infantry/Command/Support Squad.

135975.name: Fourcube
135975.description:
User Summary

I wrote this program in the 1980s for my CoCo. Tom Mix Software added it to their line of games. I think I made about $3 in sales. It was sold on a 5.25" diskette in a sealed plastic bag. Today it is still possible to play this game on a Java CoCo emulator at www.haplessgenius.com/mocha/ See the web links section.

Several bells and whistles are included: choose computer playing strength, play another human or play the computer, takeback and step forward, rotate the image of the board, AND best of all, a "Faircube" option to mitigate the advantage of the first move. To play this variant, make the first move in any cell other than the eight cube corners or the eight central cells. Or, if the computer moves first, press F and it will avoid those cells on its first move. This reduces but does not eliminate the first player advantage. It may make the game more interesting.

135976.name: Wer kennt Augsburg?
135976.description:
"Who knows Augsburg - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Augsburg.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

135977.name: Calandia Guidebook
135977.description:
From box cover:

The continent of calandia, home to the City-State of the Invincible Overlord, is an intricately knit tapestry of cultural, social, and political structures...an exciting backdrop for your fantasy role-playing campaigns.

135979.name: Strategic War in Europe
135979.description:
A board game on your screen. Strategic War in Europe allows you to play a computer game which looks and plays as a board game, but you don't have to look for a human opponent anymore.

Strategic War in Europe is a grand strategy game with possibility to command one or more among 25 countries.
War, policy, technological progress, recruiting units, conquest – this is all in your hands.
There are no restrictions in actions done during the turn, units movement, purchases, attacks, technology investments, reinforcements, all of those can be done at any moment during the player’s turn.
Maintain convoys and supply lines, transport troops through the sea, secure air supremacy and hope for good weather – all of those are ingredients of ultimate victory.
There are many paths to win the game, and with every game a new one can be tried.
War in Europe begins.

Main Features

- Six unique scenarios spanning the time between 1939-1944
- An expansive map of Europe and North Africa that is 68 hexes wide and 47 hexes high
- Ability for players to control up to 25 countries across the three WW2 alliances (Allies, Axis, USSR)
- Five scaling difficulty settings for each country for added challenge and replayability
- Build your army to attack from land, sea, and air
- Accessible economy and production system
- Supply system based on convoys and railroads
- Technology system that expands five unique areas of research
- Dynamic weather system that affects the tide of war
- Units can be boosted by commanders and gather experience, which can really change the course of war
- Possibility to customize many aspects of the game, as FOW, or tracking AI movement
- Reports which allow to easily check what happens in the past
- Unlimited number of players in hotseat mode
- Up to 4 players in PBEM mode

Source: The Publisher Website.

135981.name: Virtuoso
135981.description:
Virtuoso is a music theory board game. Players compete against each other by successfully answering trivia questions about music history, composition, listening comprehension, and theory. Not for the faint of heart, Virtuoso is a competitive, yet educational game geared for high school and college musicians to expand their knowledge and show off their mad skills.
(source: calebheisey.com - with permission from the designer/site owner)

The game debuted at the 2012 Collab Game Board Competition hosted by the Philadelphia Museum of Art (http://www.philamuseum.org/collab/).

135982.name: Ghostscape 2: The Cabin
135982.description:
User summary

Ghostscape is back, with graves, caves, and a creepy old man. Find the items he wants, and maybe you'll get out of here alive.

135983.name: Unlock
135983.description:
User Summary

Unlock is a 3D puzzle game with over 30 puzzles to solve.

135984.name: Battle Monkeys
135984.description:
Welcome to the ultimate MULTIPLAYER battle!.

The warriors gather, the crowd chant your name, are you ready for the most intense battle of your life? In a world where monkeys rule, there is only one way to find out who's the boss... FIGHT!

In this awesome 3D multiplayer game, you control a small army of monkey warriors and battle against other contestants in a live fight for your life.

- Choose from a range of different monkeys

- Customize your monkey with 1000's of outfit combinations

- Live online multiplayer action

- Amazing graphics and soundtrack

- Level up and unlock different monkeys to fight with

Source: The Developer Website.

135985.description:
Blocks in the Pacific is a new concept game covering the whole Pacific Campaign from the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor (Dec 7th 1941) till the atomic blast in Nagasaki, August 1945.

Developed on wooden blocks and cubes system, over an astonishing 172x61cm full laminated multicolor map-board, there's not any paper component, but the Manual.
All the over 500 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

HISTORICAL BACKGROUND
On Dec 7th 1941, without a declaration of war the Japanese Empire launched a devastating surprise attack against the US and the British forces in the Pacific.

BLOCKS IN THE PACIFIC recalls, in game form, the most decisive battles fought in the Pacific Theater, from the Pearl Harbor strike in December 1941 to the atomic blast over Japan in August 1945..

BLOCKS IN THE PACIFIC is a game for 1-4 players, 1-2 control the Allies and the other 1-2 control the Japanese Empire.
Although based on history, players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War 2 in the Pacific.

RULES INTRODUCTION
The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time.
The first section is the BASIC GAME RULES which introduces the basic concepts and enables players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
Then the ADVANCED GAME RULES provide more specific and detailed rules for an enhanced realism, such as the use of Fuel and the Advanced Production System.
Finally, for those players who want to get the best out of the game, OPTIONAL RULES can be added as desired.
The Optional Rules include Technology Research, Strategic warfare, Amphibious Invasions, Parachute Assaults…

SCALE: A hexagon is approximately 53 miles (70 Km) across.
A turn is 1 month long.
A full strength counter represents 300 planes, 300 Tanks, or 30,000 men, depending on the type unit, equipment and nationality.

FOG OF WAR: The game can be played with the Fog of War on (wooden blocks are placed on the map in such a way the opponent player can not see them) OR with Fog of War OFF (all units are visible).

Language: English and Italian
Genre: Operational, Strategic
Turns: Turn-Based
Complexity: Basic to Advanced, depending on which rules are used and on Scenario Lenght
Period: World War II

SCENARIOS
With over 300 units counters and 300 different resource points of various color, players can enjoy hours of fun by playing the full 1941 DAY OF INFAMY Campaign, or one of the 5 others 6-turns scenarios.

Every scenario has different Victory conditions and length, with a playing time from 1 to 20 turns.
135985.name: Blocks in the Pacific

135986.name: Time of Decisions
135986.description:
TIME of DECISIONS is the last game of the Blocks Series from VentoNuovo Games.

It covers the early years before WW2, including war in Ethiopia, Spain, Aunschluss, Invasion of Cechoslovakia...

TIME of DECISIONS is a game of World War II conflict simulation at the strategic level. It recalls the most decisive battles fought in Europe, Africa and Asia from the beginning of the invasion of Ethiopia, in summer 1936 until the dramatic end in Berlin in spring 1945. Although based on historical events and battles, the players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War II.

The game is recommended for two or more players, up to 6: one/three control the Allies, and the other one/three control Germany and the other Axis powers.
The game is furthermore suitable for solitary play: the single player just controls both sides. In this case, a play with Fog of War is suggested.

Developed with a system of wooden blocks and cubes and played out over an astonishing 125x87 cm (49"x34") full laminated multicolor mapboard, the only paper component in the box is the rules manual. In total, more than 600 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time:
• The Basic Game Rules introduce the basic concepts and enable players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
• The Advanced Game Rules provide more specific and detailed rules for enhanced realism, such as the use of Fuel and the Advanced Production System.
• The Optional Rules are for those who want to get the most out of the game, with rules for Technology Research, Strategic Warfare with the bombing of Germany and U-boat campaigns in the oceans, Amphibious Landings, Airborne Assaults, and more.

In TIME OF DECISIONS, a hexagon is approximately 53 miles (70 km) across, a turn is 1 month long, and a full-strength counter represents a major military formation (normally corps size) with 300 planes, 300 tanks, or 30,000 men, depending on the unit type, equipment, nationality, etc. The game can be played with "Fog of War" on (with the faces of wooden blocks hidden from the opponent) or off (all units are visible).

Players can compete starting from 1936 Campaign, in one of four six-turn scenarios or one of the shorter, easy-to-learn scenarios. Each scenario has different victory conditions and length, with a playing time from 1 to 99 turns.

135987.name: Aquanaut's Holiday
135987.description:
Gameplay in Aquanaut's Holiday takes place in a first-person perspective and consists primarily of the player exploring vast stretches of ocean, occasionally discovering underwater ruins or treasure, or communicating with underwater creatures. The game has no time limits, enemies, or other obstacles. The game's objective, aside from exploring, is to build a large coral reef to attract a wide variety of fish and other marine wildlife.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aquanaut's Holiday", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135989.name: Aquanaut no Kyuujitsu: Memories of Summer 1996
135989.description:
User Summary

An underwater life simulation that includes interaction with sea life and reef building.

135990.name: Aquanaut's Holiday 2
135990.description:
User Summary

A sea life simulation game that allows the player to interact with animals and explore.

135992.name: Post Time Fast Action Horse Racing Game
135992.description:
Objective: make most money
acting by turns

You have an eight race series in which to accumulate assets, through buying horses and betting them to win! And, of course, your stable of winning horses can net you big purse money. The board provided sets the odds, purse money and payoffs for each race. If you play your cards right you will be the richest owner at the track.

135994.name: Army Men: Air Combat – The Elite Missions
135994.description:
The Final game in the air combat series gave gamers the same experience from the N64 original with upgraded features, graphics, and new levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men: Air Combat - The Elite Missions", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135995.name: BeyBlade VForce: Super Tournament Battle
135995.description:
BeyBlade: Super Tournament Battle, also known as BeyBlade VForce: Super Tournament Battle and Bakuten Shoot Beyblade 2002: Nettou! Magne-tag Battle! (爆転シュートベイブレード2002 熱闘！マグネタッグバトル！) in Japan is a 2002 role-playing video game based on the anime and manga Beyblade and was released originally in 2002.

In the game, the player selects a Beyblade and a Beyblader to fight in a tournament, buying better Beyblades as the game progresses.

The object of the game is to knock your opponent out of the stadium. When launching a Beyblade, a "Launch Meter" is displayed and quickly fills itself up with a golden meter. The closer the golden meter is to its end when the player hits the launch button, the faster the Beyblade will revolve. Players can also get points if the player makes the Beyblade stop spinning or misses a launch.

The player earns four points or more if they destroy the opponent's Beyblade to pieces using a powerful assault from the Bit-Beast. In order to be capable of releasing a Bit-Beast, the player has to earn "Legend Power" points simply by hitting other Beyblades repeatedly. Bit-Beast assaults usually take a larger amount of energy from the adversary than normal assaults and they also increase the speed of the spins.

Source: Wikipedia, "BeyBlade VForce: Super Tournament Battle ", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135996.name: Bleach GC: Tasogare ni Mamieru Shinigami
135996.description:
Bleach: GC Tasogare ni Mamieru Shinigami (ＢＬＥＡＣＨ　ＧＣ　黄昏にまみえる死神?, lit. Bleach GC: Soul Reapers Meeting in the Twilight) is the first installment in the Bleach Nintendo Home Consoles series. The game was released only in Japan on December 8, 2005. It features gameplay similar to traditional 2D fighting games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bleach GC: Tasogare ni Mamieru Shinigami", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135997.name: Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale
135997.description:
Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale is a 2005 action video game developed and published by Hudson Soft. The game was released only in Japan. The games is based on the Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo manga and anime.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

135998.name: Mega Glest
135998.description:
"MegaGlest is an entertaining free (freeware and free software) and open source cross-platform 3D real-time strategy (RTS) game, where you control the armies of one of seven different factions: Tech, Magic, Egypt, Indians, Norsemen, Persian or Romans. The game is setup in one of 17 naturally looking settings, which -like the unit models- are crafted with great appreciation for detail. Additional game data can be downloaded from within the game at no cost.
...
MegaGlest is heavily based on the widely known Glest, which it forked from in early 2010. In early 2012, MegaGlest has started replacing Glest in major Linux distributions. Like its predecessor, MegaGlest is available under liberal licensing terms and can be downloaded and played free of charge."

Source: The Game Website.

135999.name: Captain Tsubasa: Ougon Sedai no Chousen
135999.description:
Captain Tsubasa: Ougon Sedai no Chousen is a 2002 sports video game released by Konami. The game was only released in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain Tsubasa: Ougon Sedai no Chousen", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136000.description:
Rivet Wars is a miniatures boardgame that springs forth from the warped imagination of Ted Terranova - set on a world that never quite left World War I but with crazy technology like walking tanks, diesel powered armor, unicycled vehicles and armor plated cavalry!

Don't let the cute visuals fool you, it's a world full of angst, war-torn camaraderie and dark humor.

Rivet Wars is at its heart a strategy game, with both players deploying units each round to counter the threats set forth by their opponent and stay one tactical step ahead.

Heavily influenced by Ted's experience working on RTS games like Rise of Nations, players gather resources (bunkers and capture points) and use these to deploy streams of new units!

There's an ebb and flow on the tactical landscape and you can stock up surprises for your opponent to be unleashed even as he thinks he's winning!
136000.name: Rivet Wars: Eastern Front

boardgameaccessory.196440: Rivet Wars: Macleod's Guards vs. Baron Munchen Guards
